byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Istanbul court issues arrest warrant for United States-based cleric Fethullah Gulen, blamed by Turkish officials for inciting failed coup; move precedes formal request to extradite cleric, with whom Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan has had longstanding feud, from Pennsylvania, where he has lived in self-imposed exile since 1999.

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Mr. Gulen, who lives in a self-imposed exile in Pennsylvania, is accused of plotting the July 15 coup attempt that left more than 250 people dead.
snippet: Mr. Gulen, who lives in a self-imposed exile in Pennsylvania, is accused of plotting the July 15 coup attempt that left more than 250 people dead....

headline.main: Turkey Issues a Warrant for Fethullah Gulen, Cleric Accused in Coup
headline.print_headline: Turkey Seeks Arrest of Cleric Living in U.S.
